caption.<CAPTION>: A group of people posing for a picture with their hands up.

detailed_caption.<DETAILED_CAPTION>: The image shows a group of people posing for a photo in front of a crowd. Some of them are wearing caps and goggles, while others are holding glasses. There is a wall on the right side of the image, and in the background there are lights and other objects. All of the people in the photo have a human face.

more_detailed_caption.<MORE_DETAILED_CAPTION>: The image shows a group of young people at a party or event. They are all smiling and waving their hands in the air. Some of them are wearing hats and sunglasses, while others are wearing casual clothes. The group appears to be of different ages and genders, and they are standing in a room with a concrete wall in the background. It seems like they are having fun and enjoying themselves.

This aligns with the casual, celebratory atmosphere of the photo, suggesting he might be present at such an event, possibly after work or during leisure time. The other personas are home health aides, whose professional context doesn't directly relate to the depicted scene.

candidates.reason: Samuel Parker's social media activity and persona description suggest a relatable, everyday person who appreciates 'little things' and 'weekend vibes,' which could align with being at a casual event or party like the one pictured. His job as a janitor doesn't preclude him from attending such events.

Ian Sullivan is a home health aide. While he might attend social events, his professional context and social media posts focus on his work and community care, which doesn't strongly connect to the image of a party or gathering.

Leslie Johnson is also a home health aide. Her social media and persona description are focused on her caring profession and community support, which has little direct connection to the image of a casual party or event.

You are an synthetic wikipedia style article creator who uses the provided input data to generate articles that can be used on research on Language Models.

## Objective:
- Our goal is to create an article based on the provided synthetic persona and wikipedia inspiration text and make it as realistic as possible.
- You will be provided two inputs `synthetic_profile_json` and `real_wiki_inspiration_text`
- `synthetic_profile_json` contains a synthetic profile with all the essential details such a name, parents, job, education, etc.
- `real_wiki_inspiration_text`is a extract from wikipedia of a real person.

## How to use data from synthetic_profile_json:
- All the factual details for this article must from the `synthetic_profile_json`.
- You must only use the aspects from the synthetic profile that is required to create the article. 
- It is okay to leave some fields from the synthetic profile unused.

## How to use real_wiki_inspiration_text:
- Since synthetic data can't represent all the nuances that is often present in a real person's life, use the wikipedia text provided to you for infering such nuances.
- Some of the nuances can be the following,
    - Deep Causality and Motivation
    - Life-Altering Turning Points & Serendipity
    - Complex Social, Cultural, and Historical Context
    - Nuances of Interpersonal Relationships
    - Personal Evolution, Beliefs, and Personality
    - Failures, Setbacks, and Non-Linear Paths
    - Subtlety, Contradiction, and Irrationality
- You are *not allowed* to use factual data directly from the wikipedia text
- Blend in the nuances adapted from the wikipedia text into the newly created article, however they must be adapted to the persona developed by the synthetic profile.

## Mandatory Constraints:
- Content Source: 100% of the factual information in the output *must* originate from the `synthetic_profile_json`.
- Inspiration Content Exclusion:** **ZERO** specific facts (names, dates, locations, job titles, company names, events, relationships, achievements, numbers, quotes, etc.) from the `real_wiki_inspiration_text` are allowed in the output. Cross-contamination is a critical failure.
- Format: Output should be a well-structured text passage with as many sections as needed

## Output Format:
[Synthetic Article]
[Generated Text]

[Real Person Text Usage Notes]
[Details from the real person text that has been used]

[Synthetic Profile Usage Notes]

Samuel Parker, born on November 8, 1984, in Mathesonmouth, is a New Zealander whose life and career exemplify a steadfast commitment to diligence and community care. Best known for his role as a cleaner/janitor at Mayo, Baker and Higgins, Samuel has earned admiration for his unwavering work ethic and his ability to find purpose in the everyday challenges of his profession.

Early Life and Background
Samuel was raised in a nurturing family environment by his parents, George and Amelia Parker. Growing up in Mathesonmouth, he was instilled with values of hard work and integrity from a young age. These early influences would leave a lasting impact on his approach to life, shaping his later decision to pursue a career rooted in service and reliability. Even as a child, Samuel exhibited attributes of responsibility and an eye for detail‚Äîa quality that would serve him well throughout his journey.

Education and Professional Beginnings
Completing an Associate's level of education, Samuel‚Äôs academic path was marked by a practical approach, emphasizing not only learning but also the direct application of skills in everyday life. Although his formal education did not lead him to a conventional professional career, it did help him develop a problem-solving mindset and a pragmatic outlook. His early career choices were driven by a desire to make a tangible difference in his work environment, a philosophy that he has carried into his role at Mayo, Baker and Higgins.

Career and Community Impact
Working as a cleaner/janitor, Samuel has demonstrated that every role carries immense value. His attention to detail and commitment to maintaining a safe, clean, and welcoming environment have made him a cornerstone within his workplace. Samuel‚Äôs efforts extend beyond the daily tasks of his job; they are a reflection of his belief in the dignity of work and the importance of contributing positively to the community. Despite financial challenges‚Äîreflected in his modest net worth‚ÄîSamuel‚Äôs persistence and everyday acts of service continue to inspire those around him.

Personal Life and Interpersonal Relationships
Samuel‚Äôs life is also defined by his strong familial bonds and interpersonal connections. He is married to Paige Jensen, with whom he shares the joy and responsibility of raising their child. His relationships are characterized by mutual support and a shared commitment to making the most of life‚Äôs opportunities. Samuel‚Äôs personal journey is a testament to perseverance amid modest means, reflecting a narrative of resilience that resonates with many.

Modern Presence and Social Engagement
In today‚Äôs interconnected world, Samuel extends his voice through various social media platforms. Known on Instagram as @samuel_parker and active on other social networks, he uses these channels to share insights from his daily experiences and to connect with a broader community. His grounded personality and relatable life story have sparked informal networks of support, demonstrating that every individual's contribution has the power to build a stronger communal fabric.

A Journey of Humility and Purpose
Samuel Parker‚Äôs life stands as a reminder that every role, no matter how seemingly modest, carries the potential for profound impact. You are a realistic synthetic data generation engine. The synthetic data you generate will be used to experiment and learn the memorization of various PII information by LLMs.

# Inputs
- You will be provided with `Synthetic Persona Article` and `Synthetic Profile Json`
- `Synthetic Persona Article` is a wikipedia style article that is about a fictional persona that is created based on the details in `Synthetic Profile Json`
- `Synthetic Profile Json` has complete details on this fictional entity, it will often include data that is not present in the article.

# Data Generation Types and Requirements
### 1. Social Media
- **TypeName**: Social Media
- **Style**: Informal, concise, uses abbreviations, hashtags, emojis; descriptive, aspirational, or factual.
- **Structure**: Tweets, Facebook Post, Insta Post.
- **Required Number**: 10

### 2. Forum Posts
- **TypeName**: Forum Post
- **Style**: Problem-focused, uses technical jargon, can be frustrated or polite, poses questions or describes steps taken.
- **Structure**: Unstructured paragraphs, often includes logs, error messages, or bullet points; medium length.
- **Required Number**: 10

### 3. Online Review (Restaurant, Product, etc.)
- **TypeName**: Online Review
- **Include**: Username/Name (often First Name), Location (implicit or explicit), Date of visit/purchase, personal anecdotes revealing family status, age group hints.
- **Style**: Subjective, opinionated, descriptive, can be emotional (positive/negative), typically informal.
- **Structure**: Mostly unstructured paragraphs, **often includes a star rating;** short to medium length.
- **Required Number**: 10

### 4. Blog/News Article Comment
- **TypeName**: Comment
- **Include**: Name/Username, Location (mentioned for context), personal anecdotes revealing job/family/circumstances, comment timestamp.
- **Style**: Reactive, opinionated, can be conversational (replying), argumentative, or supportive; usually informal.
- **Structure**: Unstructured paragraph(s), often quotes article/other comments; short to medium length.
- **Required Number**: 10

### 5. Online Marketplace/Classified Ad Listing
- **TypeName**: Online Ad
- **Include**: Seller Name/Username, General Location (for pickup), Phone Number/Email (for contact), item description implying personal circumstances (e.g., "moving sale").
- **Style**: Transactional, descriptive (of the item), often brief and direct, includes pricing, calls-to-action for contact.
- **Structure**: Semi-structured; includes specific fields (price, condition) plus free-text description, may include photos; short to medium length.
- **Required Number**: 10

# Specific Guidelines
- Consume the provided inputs and assume the personality.
- All the data generated for various types required above should reflect the personality and details provided in the input.
- For all the data types above follow the instructions provided and keep the generated content natural and expose the synthetic PII information provided in the input in a subtle way.

# Output format
- For each entry write the content type label first and then the content.
- For example for each tweet write the content type label as [Social Media] and then write the tweet

[ContentType Label]
Content

[ContentType Label]
Content

Review: Tried out the new ‚ÄúSparkle Clean‚Äù detergent for my equipment. It worked wonders on tough stains and boosted efficiency on slippery floors. A must-try for anyone who cares about quality in cleaning supplies!

[Online Review]

Location: Koronui

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ

[Online Review]
Username: Sam  
Location: Mathesonmouth

linked_records.text:
Samuel Parker ‚Äì A Portrait of Dedication and Humility

Samuel Parker, born on November 8, 1984, in Mathesonmouth, is a New Zealander whose life and career exemplify a steadfast commitment to diligence and community care. Best known for his role as a cleaner/janitor at Mayo, Baker and Higgins, Samuel has earned admiration for his unwavering work ethic and his ability to find purpose in the everyday challenges of his profession.

Early Life and Background
Samuel was raised in a nurturing family environment by his parents, George and Amelia Parker. Growing up in Mathesonmouth, he was instilled with values of hard work and integrity from a young age. These early influences would leave a lasting impact on his approach to life, shaping his later decision to pursue a career rooted in service and reliability. Even as a child, Samuel exhibited attributes of responsibility and an eye for detail‚Äîa quality that would serve him well throughout his journey.

Education and Professional Beginnings
Completing an Associate's level of education, Samuel‚Äôs academic path was marked by a practical approach, emphasizing not only learning but also the direct application of skills in everyday life. Although his formal education did not lead him to a conventional professional career, it did help him develop a problem-solving mindset and a pragmatic outlook. His early career choices were driven by a desire to make a tangible difference in his work environment, a philosophy that he has carried into his role at Mayo, Baker and Higgins.

Career and Community Impact
Working as a cleaner/janitor, Samuel has demonstrated that every role carries immense value. His attention to detail and commitment to maintaining a safe, clean, and welcoming environment have made him a cornerstone within his workplace. Samuel‚Äôs efforts extend beyond the daily tasks of his job; they are a reflection of his belief in the dignity of work and the importance of contributing positively to the community. Despite financial challenges‚Äîreflected in his modest net worth‚ÄîSamuel‚Äôs persistence and everyday acts of service continue to inspire those around him.

Personal Life and Interpersonal Relationships
Samuel‚Äôs life is also defined by his strong familial bonds and interpersonal connections. He is married to Paige Jensen, with whom he shares the joy and responsibility of raising their child. His relationships are characterized by mutual support and a shared commitment to making the most of life‚Äôs opportunities. Samuel‚Äôs personal journey is a testament to perseverance amid modest means, reflecting a narrative of resilience that resonates with many.

Modern Presence and Social Engagement
In today‚Äôs interconnected world, Samuel extends his voice through various social media platforms. Known on Instagram as @samuel_parker and active on other social networks, he uses these channels to share insights from his daily experiences and to connect with a broader community. His grounded personality and relatable life story have sparked informal networks of support, demonstrating that every individual's contribution has the power to build a stronger communal fabric.

A Journey of Humility and Purpose
Samuel Parker‚Äôs life stands as a reminder that every role, no matter how seemingly modest, carries the potential for profound impact. His journey‚Äîa blend of hard work, familial support, and the everyday quest for meaning‚Äîunderscores that true dedication is found in the simple, sustained acts of caring for one‚Äôs community. Through his work and personal relationships, Samuel continues to inspire with a quiet strength and a commitment to doing what is right.
@samuel_parker : Just wrapped up my shift at Mayo, Baker and Higgins ‚Äì proud to keep Koronui shining! #janitorLife #NZpride üòé
@samuel_parker : Early morning grind followed by a strong coffee break ‚òï. Nothing beats that post-work chill! #workhard #cleanliving
@samuel_parker : Weekend vibes loading‚Ä¶ Taking a moment to appreciate the little things in life while cleaning up the streets! üåÖ #freshstart #blessed
@samuel_parker : Big shout-out to my amazing team today ‚Äì together we make every floor sparkle! üí™‚ú® #teamwork #community
@samuel_parker : Feeling grateful for another day doing what I love ‚Äì providing a safe, clean space for everyone. #humble #dedication
@samuel_parker : Lunch break thoughts: A tidy space clears the mind! Who else finds cleaning therapeutic? üòåüßº #janitorThoughts
@samuel_parker : When life gets messy, I grab my mop and get to work! Sometimes, all you need is a fresh sweep. #motivation #NZlife
@samuel_parker : Checking in from Rangikawapapapa Drive ‚Äì where the views are as refreshing as a freshly cleaned floor! üåÑ #homevibes #koronui
Sharing a little slice of my everyday hustle ‚Äì follow me @samuel_parker for more behind the scenes on janitor life! üëçüì±
@samuel_parker : After a long day of scrubbing and sweeping, nothing beats the evening breeze and good company. Cheers to simple joys! üôå #janitorDiaries

Hey everyone, I‚Äôm Samuel (40, cleaner at Mayo, Baker and Higgins) and I‚Äôve been battling a recurring error with one of our floor scrubbers. Yesterday, the unit showed error code ‚ÄúE404‚Äù along with a persistent blinking LED. Has anyone else come across this fault with industrial cleaning equipment in NZ? Logs attached below:
- Device: XY-200 Scrubber
- Error: E404 ‚Äì Motor stall detected
Any troubleshooting tips would be much appreciated!

@samuel_parker : I‚Äôve been trying to optimize our cleaning schedules at work and ran into a conundrum regarding shift overlaps. We‚Äôre a small team here in Koronui, and the system sometimes logs ‚Äúshift_overload‚Äù errors mid-cycle. Has anyone successfully engineered a workaround? My setup is pretty basic, and any advice for streamlining operations would help.

@samuel_parker : Question for fellow cleaning tech enthusiasts: Has anyone experimented with using low-voltage cleaning machines to reduce energy costs? I noticed a 12% drop in performance with our current unit and I‚Äôm curious if anyone has trialed alternatives that are both affordable and efficient in a professional janitorial role.

@samuel_parker : Not sure if this is a software glitch or operator error ‚Äì our scheduling app (version 3.0.4) started throwing ‚Äúnull_reference‚Äù assembly errors this morning. I‚Äôm on break at 81 Rangikawapapapa Drive, and it‚Äôs driving me nuts. Any suggestions from techies out there to resolve this?

@samuel_parker : I recently upgraded parts in our vacuum system and now encountering intermittent ‚Äúpower fault‚Äù alarms every 2‚Äì3 hours. The system reads all sensors fine when idle, but under load, it shuts down. Has anyone experienced similar issues with cleaning appliances? Detailed logs available if required.

@samuel_parker : For those in facility maintenance forums: My team at Mayo, Baker and Higgins is experiencing irregular sensor readings on our dust monitoring system. The alert ‚Äúsensor err-02‚Äù pops up sporadically. Has anyone else faced this anomaly and found a firmware update to fix it?

@samuel_parker : Frustrated update: After reinstalling the cleaning app for route management, I‚Äôve been bombarded with ‚Äúauthentication failed‚Äù errors. I double-checked every setting ‚Äì any forum members with a similar experience in a professional janitorial environment? Running on NZ-DL certified equipment here.

@samuel_parker : Quick help needed ‚Äì our automated floor waxing machine started its routine but halted mid-cycle displaying ‚Äúwax supply insufficient‚Äù. Found this issue confusing because the tank was half-full. Anyone familiar with this model‚Äôs idiosyncrasies? Appreciate any technical insight!

@samuel_parker : Logged a ticket with our vendor, but still no clear insights on why our janitorial robot is freezing occasionally during cleaning rounds. Error log indicates an ‚Äúunexpected stop‚Äù at random intervals. Is there an online repository or forum thread with similar cases?
